channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How a Year of Rain Fell on Parts of Spain in Eight Hours
item.description: The region is no stranger to storms like those that caused this week’s deluges. But global warming helps them pack a bigger punch, scientists said.

item.title: Amazon’s CEO dropped a big hint about how a new AI version of Alexa is going to compete with chatbots like ChatGPT
item.description: Andy Jassy hinted that the long-awaited AI-powered Alexa will be all about taking actions, and not just providing answers. But it's unclear when the p...

item.title: Brian Niccol has to get hold of 200,000 Sharpies so he can bring back a classic Starbucks tradition
item.description: “Unfortunately it’s not as simple as going to Staples and picking up some Sharpies,” Niccol said. “That’s the power of our scale.”

item.title: A study on the Mediterranean diet offers the strongest proof yet that it’s associated with healthy brain aging
item.description: This plant-based way of eating is more of a lifestyle than a strict diet and offers a wide variety of health benefits, experts say.

item.title: Tomasz Tunguz’s Theory Ventures has raised a $450 million second fund, filings say
item.description: Theory Ventures has raised $450 million for its second fund, according to securities filings viewed by Fortune.

item.title: A Texas Judge’s Fight to Keep a High Profile Case Out of His Court
item.description: A battle over a new rule to limit credit card late fees has spiraled into a larger skirmish about how much power litigants should have to maneuver the...

item.title: All Trick, No Treat: Dublin Crowds Turn Up for Halloween Parade That Wasn’t
item.description: The scariest thing this Halloween? In one city, it was the power of a phony online event listing.

item.title: Trump Assails Liz Cheney and Imagines Guns ‘Shooting at Her’
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris said that anyone who uses “that kind of violent rhetoric is clearly disqualified, and unqualified, to be president.”

item.title: Spain Braces for More Rain and Flooding as Rescuers Dig Through Debris
item.description: The authorities said dozens of people were still missing, as forecasters warned of new flooding in the southwest of the country.

item.title: Volunteers Clean Up Debris After Unprecedented Flooding in Spain
item.description: Cars and homes were destroyed and streets were left clogged with mud in the wake of severe flooding in the Valencia region.

item.title: Israel Strikes Near Beirut as Diplomatic Push Shows No Sign of Success
item.description: The Biden administration sent envoys including the C.I.A. director to the Middle East this week, but Israel, Hezbollah and Hamas all appeared far from...

item.title: Goldman Sachs says reaching net zero will cost $75 trillion—more than two times U.S. GDP
item.description: The goals of the 2016 Paris Agreement are slipping out of reach, Goldman wrote.

item.title: Israel Strikes Near Beirut as Diplomatic Push Shows No Sign of Success
item.description: The Biden administration sent envoys including the C.I.A. director to the Middle East this week, but Israel, Hezbollah and Hamas all appeared far from...

item.title: U.S. Spy Agencies Issue New Warning on Russia’s Election Misinformation Campaign
item.description: Two recent videos have sought to undermine confidence in the security of the vote.

item.title: Spain Braces for More Rain and Flooding as Rescuers Dig Through Debris
item.description: The authorities said dozens of people were still missing, as forecasters warned of new flooding in the southwest of the country.
